column4: what does it mean when I type exit to get out of a CLI terminal, I get there are stop jobs.. Which jobs?
Cuz I was back to the prompt
ok llutz jobs... good command
type: jobs
but lets say llutz I run cp and then when it goes back to the prompt then I assume it's finished copying right? so after that, is it ok to type exit?
fg to make one of them active again
yes quiescens that√®s what llutz just said... I had never heard that one before
they should only happen if you press ctrl-z to stop whatever was running when you pressed ctrl-z
oh cool quiescens tn
tnx
that's the thing I never pressed ctrl z
sorry, my mistake, there are other things that cause it, if you run something with & which then decides it needs to wait for input
no, not even that quiescens
well, what did "jobs" say that are still running?
let me try it quiescens
it says: man ls  (wd: ~/.weechat/logs) but those two processes are running in separate tabs!
shrugs
I might need to reboot
but I learned something new thanks to llutz and you, quiescens
type fg
to bring a stopped job back to the front
